block.p: Chief Justice William H. Rehnquist rebuked the Senate for failing to move quickly enough in confirming Federal judges. In his annual year-end report on of the state of the judiciary, the Chief Justice said continuing inaction on nominees was threatening an overburdened court system. Nearly 1 in 10 seats on the Federal bench are now vacant, Mr. Rehnquist said. Orrin G. Hatch, chairman of the Judiciary Committee, defended the Senate's performance and said the courts themselves were partly to blame for their heavy caseloads.
